Description: Green porphyry(?) male figure seated cross-legged; black painted eye-detail; scribal pose. Dated by Biri Fay (pers. comm.) to second half of 12th Dynasty, temp. Senwosret III.
Curator's comments: Published: PM viii, p. 399. Parkinson, Voices from Ancient Egypt, (BM, 1991), p.18 ill. W. Seipel, Gott, Mensch, Pharao, (Vienna 1992), pp. 190-191 [59]. Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt, Japan 1999-2000, [8].
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1986 Jun-Oct, Carmarthen Museum, A son of Luxor's Sands 1988 Apr-Jun, Adeane Gallery Fitzwilliam Museum, Pharaohs & Mortals: Egyptian Art in the Middle Kingdom 1988 Jul-Aug, Liverpool Museum, Pharaohs & Mortals: Egyptian Art in the Middle Kingdom 1992 May-Oct, Vienna, Kunstlerhaus, Gott-Mensch-Pharao: Die Entwicklung des Menschenbildes in der altagyptischen Kunst 2014-2015 9 Oct-26 Jan. Palais des Beaux Arts de Lille. Senusret III. 2015, 19th June - 5th Sept. Wrexham County Borough Museum. Egyptian Written Culture. 2016 12 Mar-8 May, Carlisle, Tullie House, Writing for Eternity 2016 20 May-4 Sept, The Salisbury Museum, Writing for Eternity 2016 16 Sept-10 Jan 2017, Abergavenny Museum, Writing for Eternity 2017 21 Jan-21 May, Museum of Hartlepool, Writing for Eternity
